CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 5-1;Violation of Art. 8;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant inherited from her mother a PERCENT share in a property situated in ORG at TIME . The property consisted of an apartment building and a plot of land . On DATE the ORG ( FAC ) appointed the applicant as the administrator of the property .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , the applicant requested the previous administrator of the property , the association GPE , to cease all of its activities relating to the administration of the property . However , the association ignored her request and continued to collect rent from tenants living in the apartment building . In addition , the applicant challenged the right of Mr PERSON to collect rent from tenants leasing business LOC located in the building , claiming that his title to a part of the property had been obtained under false pretences . These challenges resulted in an on - going dispute between the applicant on the CARDINAL side and the association and Mr PERSON on the other .

CARDINAL . On DATE , Mr PERSON , acting through his counsel PERSON , brought a private prosecution against the applicant . A private bill of indictment filed by Mr PERSON alleged that the applicant was guilty of criminal libel since , on DATE , she had sent to a bank , which had made a loan to Mr PERSON , a letter stating that he had obtained the loan under false pretences and had been repaying it from income obtained from her property .

CARDINAL . During the hearing before LOC held on DATE , counsel for Mr PERSON and the applicant refused to settle the case . The applicant confirmed that on DATE she had sent the impugned letter , which had led Mr PERSON to bring the private prosecution against her . Counsel for Mr PERSON asked the court to request ORG ( GPE Zdrowia Psychicznego ) for information on whether the applicant was a patient of that clinic and , if so , to instruct it to provide the court with her medical file . Counsel based his request on the fact that , according to his knowledge , the applicant was indeed a patient at that clinic . The applicant denied that she had ever undergone psychiatric treatment and stated that counsel 's submission was slanderous . The court decided that it would consider counsel 's request in camera at DATE , and that it would request information about the applicant 's criminal record and background ( wywiad środowiskowy ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the request made on DATE and asked ORG to provide information about any medical treatment which the applicant had received there .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed ORG , in a letter signed by PERSON GPE , that on DATE the applicant had visited the clinic and that her medical file included a reference to “ suspected paranoid schizophrenia ” ( podejrzenie schizofrenii urojeniowej ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE police constable Z.A. issued a statement concerning the outcome of the background check , which had been conducted at CARDINAL FAC where the applicant resided at that time . He concluded , inter alia , that the applicant 's neighbours had a good opinion of her , that she did not drink heavily and that she was not involved in any quarrels with her neighbours .

CARDINAL . On DATE counsel for Mr PERSON requested ORG to order an expert opinion on the state of the applicant 's mental health . He also submitted several letters written by the applicant and pointed out that they showed that the applicant had claimed rent from certain tenants occupying retail and office space located on the property , despite the fact that the association PERSON had been letting out those LOC .

CARDINAL . On DATE the court appointed CARDINAL psychiatrists and a psychologist and instructed them to prepare a report on the applicant 's condition at the time of the commission of the alleged crime . On DATE the experts scheduled an appointment with the applicant for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG ( Okręgowa Izba Lekarska ) to initiate disciplinary proceedings against Dr GPE for making a false representation in her letter of DATE . The applicant contested the contents of that letter , claiming that it had been based on fabricated medical records since she had never visited ORG . The applicant 's requests for an investigation into the circumstances in which the letter had been issued were rejected by LOC and Regional Prosecutors .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , ORG ordered the applicant to report on DATE for an examination in a psychiatric ward of ORG headed by PERSON GPE The applicant 's appeals and complaints concerning that decision were rejected by the Łódź District and ORG . The applicant submitted that she had asked ORG to change the venue of her examination as she had considered that no objective opinion on her mental health could be issued after an examination in a ward headed by Dr GPE
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant failed to attend the psychiatric examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an application challenging all judges of ORG , but it was dismissed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an arrest warrant in order to secure the applicant 's compliance with its order concerning her psychiatric examination .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted that on DATE the police informed the court that the applicant had refused to open the door to her flat and the police officers had therefore been unable to enforce the arrest warrant . The applicant denied that , and pointed to the fact that on DATE she had voluntarily gone to the police station ( see below ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an order fixing CARDINAL DATE as the new date for the applicant 's compulsory psychiatric examination . However , the applicant did not keep the appointment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a new arrest warrant and scheduled the applicant 's examination for DATE . The applicant again failed to attend the examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided that the applicant should be arrested and detained on remand in order to secure her compliance with its order .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant visited the FAC ( Komenda Rejonowa Policji ) in order to file a complaint about a breaking and entry into CARDINAL of her apartments . However , her complaint was not accepted by the police and she was arrested under ORG warrant . On DATE the applicant was transferred to FAC . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's daughter filed an appeal against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE ordering the applicant 's arrest and detention . However , the appeal was rejected on DATE because the court considered that the applicant 's daughter was not authorised to file an appeal on behalf of her mother .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's counsel appealed the decision of CARDINAL October CARDINAL , but the appeal was dismissed on an unknown date .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant underwent a psychiatric examination . The psychiatrists who examined the applicant concluded that they could not make a diagnosis based on a single examination , and recommended that the applicant undergo a psychiatric examination in a public hospital . They also stated that only if the applicant failed to present herself for an examination at the public hospital should she be subjected to an examination in a prison hospital . On DATE she was released from detention .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the applicant 's daughter applied twice to ORG for leave to visit the applicant . Both applications were allowed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG decided that the applicant should undergo a psychiatric examination in a medical establishment ( zakład leczniczy ) . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Wojewódzki ) dismissed the applicant 's appeal against that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the experts appointed by the court to examine the applicant informed it that the examination could take place CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again failed to report for an examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an arrest warrant because of the applicant 's failure to attend a psychiatric examination at a public hospital . The court decided that she would be detained on remand under LAW ) of LAW . It considered that the applicant had obstructed the criminal proceedings against her since she had not attended the hospital , despite being served with a summons , and because the police were unable to bring her to the hospital .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued a search warrant , considering that the applicant was in hiding since she was not staying at her residence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested . On DATE she was transferred to prison .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed an application for leave to visit the applicant filed by the applicant 's daughter .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal against ORG decision to arrest her . On DATE the experts advised the court that the applicant 's examination could start on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant 's daughter , PERSON , filed with ORG an application for leave to visit the applicant . She asked for CARDINAL separate authorisations , for herself and her sister PERSON GPE , to visit their mother on “ multiple occasions ” ( wielokrotne widzenia ) . On CARDINAL DATE the judge noted the following instruction to the registry :
“ Inform PERSON that the court gives CARDINAL authorisation per month as far as meetings with a detainee are concerned , and other [ authorisations ] only in exceptional cases . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's request that she be released from prison .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the application for leave to visit the applicant filed by the applicant 's daughter .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal against ORG decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and CARDINAL DATE the applicant underwent a psychiatric examination in the prison hospital at FAC . CARDINAL . A medical opinion issued after that examination concluded that the applicant 's intellectual ability was substantially above average and that she showed no signs of being either mentally ill or retarded . The opinion also stated that she had a paranoid personality and that she had understood what she was doing at the time of the commission of the alleged offence .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , on CARDINAL DATE ORG allowed the application for leave to visit the applicant filed by the applicant 's daughter .

CARDINAL . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Vice - President of ORG advised the applicant that her examination in a medical establishment had been ordered by a court in response to the request by psychiatrists , who had concluded that they had been unable to draw up an expert opinion on the applicant 's mental health after a single examination .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was transferred to FAC . CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the application for leave to visit the applicant filed by her daughter .
DATE . On DATE the applicant was released from prison .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , the ORG discontinued the criminal proceedings against the applicant .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § QUANTITY of LAW DATE ( “ the Code ” ) , in so far as relevant , provides :

“ A person who , because of being mentally retarded or ill ... , could not understand his acts or who could not control his behaviour [ at the time of the commission of the offence ] shall not be criminally responsible . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of the LAW , in so far as relevant , provides :
“ Detention on remand may be imposed if : ...
CARDINAL . there is a reasonable risk that [ the accused ] will attempt to induce witnesses to give false testimony or to obstruct the proper course of proceedings by any other unlawful means ... ”
CARDINAL . DATE ) of the LAW , in so far as relevant , reads as follows :
“ If it proves necessary for the purposes of taking evidence , the accused shall submit to :
( CARDINAL ) the external examination of the body and other examinations not involving interference with the body ... ”
CARDINAL . Paragraph CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of ORG concerning the rules governing detention on remand provides as follows :
“ A person detained on remand may have visits after obtaining permission from the organ at whose disposal he remains , unless that organ decides otherwise . ”
